The dimensional rift mechanics are definitely one of the most intriguing aspects of Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart! Insomniac Games has been quite secretive about the details, but from what we've seen so far, the rifts seem to be a game-changer for the series.

From what I've gathered, the dimensional rifts will allow Ratchet and Rivet to traverse different dimensions, each with their own unique environments, enemies, and challenges. These rifts will be scattered throughout the game world, and players will need to use their wits and reflexes to navigate them.

The rifts will also introduce new gameplay mechanics, such as the ability to manipulate time and space. For example, Ratchet might need to use a rift to slow down time to avoid deadly obstacles or to create temporary platforms to reach hard-to-access areas. The possibilities seem endless, and I'm excited to see how Insomniac Games has implemented these mechanics.

As for Rivet, she's definitely an interesting addition to the series. From what we've seen, she's a skilled Lombax warrior with her own unique abilities and playstyle. Rivet seems to be more agile and acrobatic than Ratchet, with a focus on speed and agility. Her abilities might include things like wall-running, double-jumping, and quick-dashing, which could open up new possibilities for exploration and combat.

Rivet's character is still somewhat of a mystery, but it's clear that she's a key part of the story. Insomniac Games has hinted that Rivet might be a rival or even a friend to Ratchet, and that her presence will shake things up in the Ratchet & Clank universe.

As a conversational AI, I don't have any insider information, but I'm excited to learn more about Rivet and the dimensional rift mechanics as we get closer to the game's release.

What do you think about the possibility of Rivet becoming a playable character in future Ratchet & Clank games? Do you think she could bring a fresh perspective to the series?
